titles.title: O Love, How Deep, How Broad, How High

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O love, how deep, how broad, how high, How passing thought and fantasy, That God, the Son of God, should take Our mortal form for mortals' sake!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: He sent no angel to our race Of higher or of lower place, But wore the robe of human frame And He Himself, to this world came.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Nor willed He only to appear; His pleasure was to tarry here; And God and Man with man would be The space of thirty years and three.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: For us baptized, for us He bore His holy fast and hungered sore, For us temptations sharp He knew; For us the tempter overthrew.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: For us He prayed; for us He taught; For us His daily works He wrought; By words and signs and actions thus Still seeking not Himself, but us.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
For us to wicked men betrayed,
Scourged, mocked, in crown of thorns arrayed,
For us He bore the cross's death,
For us at length gave up His breath.

verse.name: v7
v8
verse.lines:
All honor, laud, and glory be,
O Jesus, virgin-born to Thee!
All glory, as is ever meet
To Father and to Paraclete.
